reviews.raw_text:
There were 4 of us eating there during family weekend.  We all had similar meals and all got food poisoning.   I know they were busy, but I cannot imagine how many families suffered like all of us!  Poorly managed.

We were waiting for the cod burger, but it ran out just before us. I got the Cali and it was nice but I will have to go back for the cod and see what all the fuss about it is cause it had a long queue and it doesn‚Äôt have stores anywhere else.

Update: I had the cali, aji and the cod and the aji is definitely THE best!!! It has a little kick to it with the jalape√±o and cilantro sauce(which you can‚Äôt really tell there‚Äôs cilantro inside). God this is amazing. Their new location is in the USC village and is so pretty in good weather

reviews.raw_text: Service: 1

Been following softies since the smorg days and was really excited to make the trip and finally visit the brick and mortar. I had high expectations and was disappointed that the vibe was not quite what I was expecting. I know everyone has bad days but I wish the customer service had been a bit more helpful and more welcoming. Cashier was cold and almost felt bothered when taking my order which kinda made it feel like a very McDonalds experience. I do however know everyone has bad days.
Overall food was solid but dont forget to add and will definitely be back to give softies another shot.

Food: 4
Service: 2
Atmosphere: 3

reviews.raw_text:
Softies totally lived up to the hype! We tried The Cali, The Aji, and the Crispy Shroom ‚Äî all solid, but The Aji was the winner with that jalape√±o and aioli combo üî•. Definitely recommend the double patty on the Shroom for a better balance. Loaded tots (Aji style) were a must, and the Orange Bang + Limonada combo hit the spot!

Even during a hectic lunch rush and a tech hiccup, the staff was friendly, calm, and on top of it all. Clean space, great energy, and bonus points for the pet-friendly patio. We‚Äôll be back!

Service: Dine in
Price per person: $10‚Äì20
Food: 5
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5
Recommended dishes
Vegetarian options: There is a veggie option that I personally have not tried.
Dietary restrictions: Staff is friendly enough to accommodate where they can!
Parking space: Plenty of parking
Parking options: Free parking garage, Paid parking garage
Parking: first 2 hours free!
Kid-friendliness: Kid friendly! Saw a bunch of small humans running around!
Wheelchair accessibility: Ground floor, seems like everywhere at USC village is wheelchair friendly.

reviews.raw_text:
I went there on July, Sunday 27th. I bought a chopped cheese sandwich. I waited 43 minutes and my order was still not made, so I asked them how long more, and he said there are a few order before mine and the other girl offered me an orange juice to wait and the guy offered me a refund and I was about to take the refund when they gave me a ‚Äúsandwich,‚Äù at home I was so hungry that I ate the first half without noticing that it was the WRONG order! They chopped off a burger and placed it inside a hot dog bun, NO CHEESE, and almost nothing else in there! That is not worth $17 especially after waiting 43 mins. Yeah, I timed it and wasn‚Äôt even crowded. Very frustrated and angry about this experience. I don‚Äôt know if they treated me like this because I‚Äôm not a student or why. Terrible service!

Price per person: $10‚Äì20
Food: 1
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 1
Wait time: 30-60 min
